channel.title: Job on Christian Internet Resources
channel.description: Recent content in Job on Christian Internet Resources

item.title: Job 1
item.description:
Job Chapter 1

1 Job lived in the land of Uz, a blameless, godly man that respected God and shunned evil. 2He had seven sons and three daughters; 3and owned 7,000 sheep, 3,000 camels, 500 yoke of oxen, 500 female donkeys; and servants. 4His sons would hold feasts in each other’s houses and invite their three sisters. 5When the feasting days had completed their cycle, Job would consecrate them, getting up early and offering burnt offerings for each one, “Maybe my children have sinned and cursed God in their hearts."

item.title: Job 2
item.description:
Job Chapter 2

1 On another day when the sons of God came to present themselves to the LORD, Satan came with them. 2The LORD asked him, 3"Have you noticed my servant Job? There’s nobody like him in the world, a blameless, godly man that respects me and shuns evil. He still maintains his integrity, even though you incited me against him to ruin him for no reason." 4"Skin for skin! Everything mortalsm have they’ll give for their life. 5Reach out and touch his flesh and bone, and he’ll curse you to your face."

item.title: Job 3
item.description:
Job Chapter 3

1 Afterward Job cursed the day he was born: [2]

4 May that be a dark day;

5 Let darkness and gloom claim it,

6 Let darkness seize that night;

7 Let that night be barren,

8 Let them curse it who curse the daytime,

9 Let its morning stars be blacked out;

12 Why did the knees receive me

13 Then I would’ve lain down in peace;

item.title: Job 4
item.description:
Job Chapter 4

1 Eliphaz the Temanite answered:

3 You’ve admonished many people

4 What you’ve said has helped the tottering stand

5 But now difficulty has come to you,

6 Isn’t your reverence for God your confidence,

8 In my experience, those who plow sin

9 They perish by God’s breath;

10 A lion roars; it can roar loud;

11 A lion perishes because there’s no prey,

13 In my dreams at night when deep sleep comes,

item.title: Job 5
item.description:
Job Chapter 5

1 Call out for help now; will anybody answer you?

2 Adversity slays the foolish;

3 I’ve seen the foolish taking root

4 Their children are never safe,

5 The hungry eat up their harvest;

10 He sends rain

11 He sets the humble up high

12 He frustrates devious plots

13 He catches the wise in their own shrewdness

14 They run into darkness in the daytime

item.title: Job 6
item.description:
Job Chapter 6

1 Job answered:

3 It would outweigh the sand by the seashore;

4 The arrows of the Almighty are piercing me;

5 Does a wild donkey bray when it has grass?

6 Does anyone eat tasteless food without salting it?

7 My mouth won’t touch them;

9 Oh that he’d be willing to crush me,

10 This is my consolation:

11 I don’t have enough strength to endure.

item.title: Job 7
item.description:
Job Chapter 7

1 Aren’t people forced into hard labor?

2 Like a slave panting for shade,

3 I’ve been allotted months of emptiness

4 When I’m in bed, I say, ‘When is morning ever going to get here?’

5 My body is covered with maggots and scabs;

6 My days fly by faster than a weaver’s shuttle

8 People won’t see me for long

9 Like a dissipating cloud,

item.title: Job 8
item.description:
Job Chapter 8

1 Bildad the Shuhite answered:

3 Does God pervert justice?

4 When your children sinned against him,

5 If you look for God and beg for mercy from the Almighty,

7 Though you started with little,

10 Won’t they teach you

12 While they’re still growing and not ready to be cut,

13 The paths of everyone that forgets God are like that;

14 What they depend on breaks down;

item.title: Job 9
item.description:
Job Chapter 9

1 Job answered:

3 If you wanted to dispute with him,

4 He’s so wise and powerful;

6 He can shake the earth and make its pillars tremble;

8 He alone stretched out the sky

9 He made the Bear, Orion, the Pleiades,

10 He does great, unimaginable things,

12 He snatches away; who can stop him?

13 God won’t turn away his anger;

15 Even if I were innocent, I couldn’t answer him;

item.title: Job 10
item.description:
Job Chapter 10

1 I detest my life;

2 I’ll tell God, ‘Don’t just condemn me;

3 Is it right for you to oppress me, to reject my toil,

4 Do you just have physical eyes

5 Are your days like a mortal’s,

7 You know I’m not guilty;

9 Remember, you made me out of clay;

10 Didn’t you pour me out like milk,

12 You’ve granted me enduring love

item.title: Job 11
item.description:
Job Chapter 11

1 Zophar the Naamathite answered:

3 Will your babble shut people up?

4 You claim your beliefs are pure

8 They’re higher than the skyâ€”what can you do?

9 They measure longer than the world

10 If he passes through or imprisons

11 He knows worthless people;

12 A stupid man can no more become intelligent

14 If there’s sin in you, get rid of it;

15 Then you can hold your head up,

item.title: Job 12
item.description:
Job Chapter 12

1 Job answered:

3 But I’m as smart as you are;

4 I’m a laughingstock to my friends,

5 In the thoughts of people at ease,

6 Destroyers prosper;

8 Speak to the earth; it will inform you;

9 Who among them doesn’t know

10 The life of every living thing lies in his hand,

11 Doesn’t the ear test words

12 Old people have wisdom;

14 He tears down, and no one can rebuild;

item.title: Job 13
item.description:
Job Chapter 13

1 I’ve seen that;

2 What you know, I know too;

4 You men are smearing me with things that aren’t true;

5 Oh that you’d just be quiet

6 Hear me out;

7 Will you lie to defend God?

8 Will you favor him by how you testify?

9 How will you fare when he examines you?

10 He’ll rebuke you for sure

11 Doesn’t his majesty terrify you,

item.title: Job 14
item.description:
Job Chapter 14

1 Mortals born of women

2 They come out and wither like a flower;

3 You keep your eyes open at them

4 Who can make unclean into clean?

5 Since their days are set,

6 Turn your gaze away so they can relax

8 Though its roots grow old in the ground

10 But people die and just lie there;

11 As water evaporates from the sea

item.title: Job 15
item.description:
Job Chapter 15

1 Eliphaz the Temanite answered:

3 Should you argue with useless speech,

4 You’re losing reverence for God

5 Your sin is telling you what you say,

6 You condemn yourself; I don’t;

8 Can you hear God’s secret counsel?

9 What do you know that we don’t know?

10 There are gray-haired, aged men around here

11 Are God’s consolations too small for you

12 Why does your heart carry you away?

item.title: Job 16
item.description:
Job Chapter 16

1 Job answered:

3 Is there no end to windy words?

4 I could talk to you like you’re talking if I was in your place.

5 Or, I could encourage you

7 God has worn me out;

8 He has made me skin and bones

9 His anger hunts me down and tears me up;

10 People gape at me with their mouth

11 God has handed me over to ungodly people

item.title: Job 17
item.description:
Job Chapter 17

1 My spirit’s broken; my days are snuffed out;

2 Mockers sit around

4 You’ve kept them from understanding;

5 They inform against their friends

7 My sight is blurry from grieving;

8 Godly people are appalled at such a thing;

9 The righteous hold onto their way;

11 My days are done;

12 You friends claim night is day and say,

13 If I look for the grave to be my house

item.title: Job 18
item.description:
Job Chapter 18

1 Bildad the Shuhite answered:

3 Why do you treat us like animals?

4 Are you going to tear yourself to pieces in your anger?

6 Their tent is dark inside;

7 Their long strides have shortened;

8 They get caught in a net by their feet

9 A trap seizes them by the heel;

10 A noose for them is hidden on the ground;

11 Panic all around terrifies them

item.title: Job 19
item.description:
Job Chapter 19

1 Job answered:

3 You’ve insulted me ten times over;

4 Even if I did make mistakes,

5 If you’re acting superior to me

8 He has blocked my way so I can’t go on;

9 He has stripped me of my honor

10 He has destroyed me on every side; I’m finished;

11 He has flashed his anger at me

12 His troops have come at me in force;

item.title: Job 20
item.description:
Job Chapter 20

1 Zophar the Naamathite answered:

3 I’ve listened to your insults,

4 Don’t you know from of oldâ€”

6 Though they’re as tall as the sky,

8 They’ll fly away like a dream,

9 People that saw them before won’t see them again;

10 Their offspring will have to give back

11 They may have youthful health,

15 Though they swallow wealth, they’ll vomit it up;

16 They’ll suck the poison of asps;

item.title: Job 21
item.description:
Job Chapter 21

1 Job answered:

3 Bear with me;

4 Am I just complaining about people?

5 Be appalled at the way I look;

6 When I think about it,

7 Why do bad people keep on living

8 Their descendants are secure in their presence;

9 They have safe houses,

10 Their bulls breed without fail,

11 They let out their little ones like a flock

12 They sing to the accompaniment of tambourines and harps

item.title: Job 22
item.description:
Job Chapter 22

1 Eliphaz the Temanite answered:

3 Is the Almighty delighted if you’re good?

4 Surely it’s not because you revere him that he’s reproving you,

5 Isn’t it more likely that you’re sinful,

6 Maybe you’ve exacted pledges from your friends

7 Maybe you’ve withheld water from the fainting

8 Maybe you think the land belongs to the powerful,

9 Maybe you’ve sent widows away with nothing

item.title: Job 23
item.description:
Job Chapter 23

1 Job answered:

3 If only I knew where to find him

4 I’d present my case

5 I’d find out what he’d answer

6 Would he oppose me with his great power?

7 Someone godly would be reasoning with him,

9 When he acts in the north, I can’t see it;

10 But he knows where I’m going;

11 I’ve stayed close to his steps

12 I haven’t veered off from his commands;

item.title: Job 24
item.description:
Job Chapter 24

1 Why doesn’t the Almighty maintain

2 Some remove landmarks,

4 They run the needy off the road;

5 Like wild donkeys in the desert,

6 They gather fodder in the field

7 They spend the night without enough clothes

8 They’re soaked from mountain rain

10 They make the naked go without clothes

11 They press out oil between the olive rows

12 From the city, the people groan,

item.title: Job 25
item.description:
Job Chapter 25

1 Bildad the Shuhite answered:

3 Who can count his troops?

4 How can anyone be innocent in his presence?

5 If the moon isn’t bright

item.title: Job 26
item.description:
Job Chapter 26

1 Job answered:

3 What counsel you’ve given me in my stupidity!

4 Who’ve you been talking to?

6 Sheol is naked in front of him;

7 He stretches out the north over empty space

8 He wraps up water in his clouds,

9 He shrouds the full moon in clouds.

10 He has set the horizon between the water above and below

11 The mountains, pillars of the sky, tremble

item.title: Job 27
item.description:
Job Chapter 27

1 Job continued his comments:

4 I won’t speak wickedness or lie.

5 I’ll never concede that you’re right;

6 I’ll hold onto my claim about my goodness,

8 What hope do the godless have when God cuts them off,

9 Will he listen to their outcry

10 Will they be able to delight in the Almighty

11 Let me teach you about God’s power;

12 You’ve all seen that;

item.title: Job 28
item.description:
Job Chapter 28

1 There’s a mine for silver

2 Iron comes out of the ground,

3 They use a torch in the darkness

4 They sink mine shafts far from where people live

5 People grow food on top of the ground;

6 Its rocks yield lapis lazuli,

7 Birds of prey can’t get to it;

8 Proud animals don’t set foot in it;

9 Miners find flint

10 They chisel out tunnels in the rock

item.title: Job 29
item.description:
Job Chapter 29

1 Job took up his discourse again:

8 Young men saw me and stepped aside,

11 When people heard me, they praised me;

13 People about to die blessed me;

14 I dressed in goodness;

15 I served as eyes for the blind and feet for the lame.

16 I became a father to the needy

17 I broke the jaws of the wicked

18 Then I supposed, ‘I’ll die in my nest

item.title: Job 30
item.description:
Job Chapter 30

1 But now people younger than me make fun of me,

2 What good was their strength to me,

3 They were haggard from hunger and want

4 They picked wild greens from among the bushes

5 People drove them away;

6 So they lived in ravines, caves, and rocks;

8 A senseless, unnamed bunch,

10 They’re appalled at me and shrink back;

11 Because God has removed my bowstring and cast me down,

item.title: Job 31
item.description:
Job Chapter 31

1 I’ve made a covenant with my eyes

2 What is our portion from God above,

3 Isn’t it misfortune for the unjust,

4 Doesn’t he see everything I do

7 If I’ve strayed off the road,

11 That would be shameful,

15 Didn’t the One that made me in the womb make the accuser too?

30 No, I haven’t let my mouth sin

32 No foreigner has had to lodge outside;

item.title: Job 32
item.description:
Job Chapter 32

1 The three men stopped replying to Job, because he was certain he was innocent. 2Then Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite from the family of Ram, was mad at Job because he’d justified himself to God. 3He was mad at his three friends because they couldn’t answer Job but still condemned him. 4Elihu had waited to speak because they were years older than he was. 5When he saw they didn’t provide an answer, his anger burned inside him. 6So he spoke up:

item.title: Job 33
item.description:
Job Chapter 33

1 But now, Job, listen to what I have to say;

2 I’m opening my mouth now;

3 What I’m saying expresses my uprightness;

4 The Spirit of God has made me;

5 Answer me if you can;

6 I belong to God like you do;

7 I shouldn’t be a threat to you;

10 He invents pretexts against me

11 He puts my feet in stocks

item.title: Job 34
item.description:
Job Chapter 34

1 Elihu continued:

4 Let’s choose what’s right;

6 Should I lie about my goodness?

7 Who is like Job

11 He pays everyone according to what they’ve done

12 God doesn’t act wickedly;

13 Who gave him authority over the earth?

14 If he’d take back his spirit,

17 Would God be ruling if he hated justice?

20 They die quickly;

22 There’s no darkness or deep shadow

item.title: Job 35
item.description:
Job Chapter 35

1 Elihu continued:

3 You say, ‘What advantage will I have?

4 I’ll answer you and your friends.

5 Look at the sky;

6 If you’ve sinned, what do you gain against God?

7 If you’re good, what good are you doing for him?

8 Your goodness is for other people like you.

10 But nobody says, ‘Where’s God my Maker,

12 There bad people call out, but he doesn’t answer

item.title: Job 36
item.description:
Job Chapter 36

1 Elihu continued:

3 I’ll bring my knowledge from afar

4 What I’m saying is true;

5 God is powerful, but he doesn’t despise anybody;

6 He doesn’t keep sinners alive,

7 He doesn’t take his eyes off of good people,

8 If they’re bound in chains

10 He opens their ears to instruction

11 If they listen and serve him,

12 But if they ignore him,

item.title: Job 37
item.description:
Job Chapter 37

1 My heart pounds when I think about this;

2 Listen closely to his thundering,

3 He unleashes his lightning under the whole sky;

4 After it his roars;

5 God thunders wondrously

6 He tells the snow to fall on the ground

7 He stops everyone’s labor

8 Animals head for their dens

9 The stormy wind comes from its rooms,

10 God’s breath makes ice,

item.title: Job 38
item.description:
Job Chapter 38

1 God answered Job out of the whirlwind:

3 Gird up* like a man;

4 Where were you when I laid the foundation for the earth?

5 Who specified its measurements

6 What did its pylons rest on?

14 The earth is stamped like clay under a seal;

15 Light is withheld from sinners,

17 Have the gates of death been revealed to you;

18 Do you have any idea how big the earth is?

item.title: Job 39
item.description:
Job Chapter 39

1 Do you know when mountain goats give birth?

2 Can you count the months of their gestation

3 They crouch down to deliver their young.

4 Their offspring grow strong out in the open;

6 I gave it the open country for a home,

7 It scorns city turmoil

8 It roams the mountains for pasture,

10 Can you harness it to plow in a furrow?

item.title: Job 40
item.description:
Job Chapter 40

1 The LORD said to Job,

3 Job said,

5 I’ve spoken once or twice; that’s enough;

6 The LORD answered him out of the storm:

8 Will you really try to discredit me to justify yourself?

9 Do you have an arm like mine?

11 Pour out your overflowing anger;

12 Look down on everybody that’s arrogant;

13 Bury them in the dust together;

14 Then I’ll acknowledge to you

item.title: Job 41
item.description:
Job Chapter 41

1 Can you pull Leviathan in on a fishhook

2 Can you tie it up with a rope in its nose

3 Will it beg you for mercy

4 Will it agree to work for you

5 Will you make a pet out of it like a bird

6 Will traders bid on it

7 Can you hurt its hide with harpoons

8 Put your hands on it, and you’ll remember the fight!

item.title: Job 42
item.description:
Job Chapter 42

1 Job answered the LORD:

3 You asked, ‘Who is this that darkens my counsel with ignorance?’

4 You said, ‘Listen; I’ll talk;

5 I’d only heard about you before,

6 So I take back what I’ve said

7 After the LORD addressed Job, he told Eliphaz the Temanite, “I’m aggravated with you and your two friends because you haven’t said about me what’s right like Job has. 8So take 7 bulls and 7 rams to him and offer up a burnt offering for yourselves. He’ll pray for you, and I’ll accept him so I won’t do to you what you deserve, because you haven’t said about me what’s right like he has."
